result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Sparrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 9/1/2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
____________________
No drivers license suspension imposed.
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court denied the defense request for expungment upon successfully completion of probation.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Report on 8/21/2015 by 8:15 a.m. in Safety Building room 310.  Good time cedit. Release for work, inmate work assignments, Day Reporting Center.  Court notes strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Sparrow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deput Court Clerk: tmk

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with good time credit; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. REPORT on 08-21-2015 by 8:15 am, in Safety Building room 310. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- No drivers license suspension imposed.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 09-01-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
- For the reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; 

Calendar call scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
From employer of behalf of defendant received and filed. tk
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 12, 2015 received and filed. tk

ADDRESS INFO for Chad Sparrow
Current: 1312 1/2 Michigan, South Milwaukee, WI 53172   (Effective: 01-30-2015)
Prior: 319 Menomonee Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Court REITERATES that the defendant is under all conditions in bail, which includes absolute sobriety. Case remains calendared for 08-14-2015 on 01:30 pm in Branch 17.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Drug Test: Positive received and filed. tk 
Court will address report 07/27/2015 at 1:30 pm.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Court orders defendant RELEASED to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Arguments heard as to bail. Cash Bond  Bond Set at $100.00.  Court amends conditions.  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. Case passed. Case recalled and Court placed in chambers discussion on the record. Case proceeded to bail/bond hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
signed and filed. lms
STIPULATION FOR SUBSTITUTION OF COUNSEL, received and filed. lms

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has picked up a new case.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defense request case be transferred to br. 17 for global resolution.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
Per request from State, case is adjourned from 8/10/2015 to 6/29/2015.  Parties notified.   lms

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court vacated warrant. Defendant has negative tests, and made all contacts. Defendant almost completed assessment fee payment. Defendant needs to complete community service. 

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Joseph Donald, Branch 2.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has possibly picked up new charges.     Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 2/10/15 @ 1:30pm
